name: Kepler-253
scenarioDescription:
The Kepler-253 Exoplanetary System

Kepler-253 is a star with 0.685 times the mass of the Sun, and 0.79 times its radius. It is located 2801.45 light years away from the solar system.

Kepler-253 is known to have 3 exoplanets in orbit around it.

Kepler-253 b

Kepler-253 b was discovered by the Kepler observatory using the transit method. Its discovery was announced in 2014-03. Its semi-major axis is 0.05 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. It takes 3.78 Earth days to complete an orbit around its host star, Kepler-253.

The mass of Kepler-253 b is 3.09 times the mass of Earth. The radius of Kepler-253 b is 1.63 that of Earth. At 3.09 Earth masses, Kepler-253 b is a so called Super Earth. Super Earths could be terrestrial worlds like Earth, but they could also be ocean worlds or terrestrial worlds wrapped in a substantial atmosphere, in which case some refer to them as Mini Neptunes. No Super Earths are known to exist in our solar system, but if it exists, the so-called Planet Nine could very well be a super Earth, as it is hypothesized to have a mass between five and ten Earth masses.

Kepler-253 c

Kepler-253 c was discovered by the Kepler observatory using the transit method. Its discovery was announced in 2014-03. Its semi-major axis is 0.09 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. It takes 10.28 Earth days to complete an orbit around its host star, Kepler-253.

The mass of Kepler-253 c is 9.93 times the mass of Earth. The radius of Kepler-253 c is 2.65 that of Earth. At 9.93 Earth masses, Kepler-253 c is a so called Super Earth. Super Earths could be terrestrial worlds like Earth, but they could also be ocean worlds or terrestrial worlds wrapped in a substantial atmosphere, in which case some refer to them as Mini Neptunes. No Super Earths are known to exist in our solar system, but if it exists, the so-called Planet Nine could very well be a super Earth, as it is hypothesized to have a mass between five and ten Earth masses.

Kepler-253 d

Kepler-253 d was discovered by the Kepler observatory using the transit method. Its discovery was announced in 2014-03. Its semi-major axis is 0.13 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. It takes 18.12 Earth days to complete an orbit around its host star, Kepler-253.

The mass of Kepler-253 d is 15.36 times the mass of Earth. The radius of Kepler-253 d is 3.17 that of Earth. At more than 10 Earth masses, Kepler-253 d is an ice giant, a planet that is made up mostly of volatiles like water, amonia and methane, and enveloped by a dense hydrogen and helium atmosphere, much like Uranus and Neptune in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system Kepler-253, which contains 3 planets and was discovered by Kepler.
